Question: Hillary Rodham and Bill **** bought a house in Fayetteville in the summer of 1975, and Hillary finally agreed to marry.
Hints: In anticipation of high sales, publisher Simon & Schuster paid this person a near-record advance of $8 million.
In 2004 and 2006, this person voted against the Federal Marriage Amendment that sought to prohibit same-sex marriage.
When **** left the State Department, it marked the first time she was a fully private citizen in thirty years.
